Package com.i2group.apollo.commandservice

The i2 Analyze command service provides clients with the ability to execute commands that make changes to data, and to manage the leases that help determine which commands a particular client can execute at a given moment in time.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    ICommandService
    A pair of methods for executing commands and renewing leases that affect the contents of the Analysis Repository.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    LeaseInUseException.Fault
    Contains information about the enclosing LeaseInUseException.
    LeaseNotHeldException.Fault
    Contains information about the enclosing LeaseNotHeldException.
    LeaseRequiresLatestVersionException.Fault
    Contains information about the enclosing LeaseRequiresLatestVersionException.
    TooManyCardsException.Fault
    Contains information about the enclosing TooManyCardsException.
    TooManyLinksException.Fault
    Contains information about the enclosing TooManyLinksException.
    TooManyLinksToMergeException.Fault
    Contains information about the enclosing TooManyLinksToMergeException.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    LeaseInUseException
    The exception raised when an attempt is made to take a lease on an Item that has already been leased.
    LeaseNotHeldException
    The exception raised when an attempt is made to modify an Item without having a lease.
    LeaseRequiresLatestVersionException
    The exception raised when an attempt is made to take a lease on an Item that is not at the latest version.
    TooManyCardsException
    The exception raised when an attempt is made to give an Item more than the maximum allowed number of Cards.
    TooManyLinksException
    The exception raised when an attempt is made to give an Entity more than the maximum allowed number of Links.
    TooManyLinksToMergeException
    The exception raised when an attempt is made to merge source Entitys that together have more than the maximum allowed number of Links.

Package com.i2group.apollo.commandservice Description

The i2 Analyze command service provides clients with the ability to execute commands that make changes to data, and to manage the leases that help determine which commands a particular client can execute at a given moment in time.

The commands that the command service offers include those for:

  • creating and deleting items
  • amending item details
  • adding and removing items from sets
  • changing item security permissions
  • taking and releasing leases
To protect against concurrent modification to the same data, the command service requires clients to take a lease on an item before they are allowed to modify it. Clients take leases on items implicitly when they create them, or explicitly by executing a "take lease" command.

Leases expire after a configurable period, but clients requiring shorter or longer leases can release or renew them. Only one client can hold the lease for a particular item at a time, and the command service uses its lease store to keep track of lease ownership.

To use the command service, a client creates commands, places them in a list, and submits them to the service for execution. The order in the list is significant, since (for example) the command that takes a lease on an item must appear before the command that modifies it.

Web methodDescription
ExecuteCommands Executes named commands in the specified command list, in the order in which they appear.
RenewLeases Renews the leases on the items with the specified identifiers.

On receiving a call to execute a list of commands, the command service:

  • validates the list of submitted commands, which includes checking leases, versions, and access permissions
  • executes those commands to generate events, and
  • places those events into the event store.
The command service validates and executes the commands in a list atomically using XA transactions, so that the whole list completely succeeds, or completely fails. The events that reach the other services are always valid.
Since:
1.0
